events.name: Journey Into The World Of Electronics Workshop
events.description:
Unleash your inner innovator and join us in this fun-filled activity for kids aged 8-11 years old on Electronics Prototyping. At the end of the session, kids will be able to design their very own Morse Code Communicator. 
Hurry! Limited to 8 children per session! 
Session 1: 5 August (Sat), 10am - 12pm
Session 2: 12 August (Sat), 10am - 12pm


About the Organiser: Electronics Made Easy
Electronics Made Easy consists of a team of young engineers keen on educating the future generation through fun and engaging programs. The team believes that instead of repetitive work, learning through a building block style will be the best way forward to creating the best engineers for Singapore. They have organised countless workshops and activities for children. 

Enquiries
Please contact Gabriel at 96530164 for any enquiries.
*Elements of banner designed by Freepik, with various icon elements designed by Freepik from www.flaticon.com
events.location: Informatics City Campus, 100 Victoria Street  #13-01/02 National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore 188064

events.name: Tech Innovations - Connecting Outer Space to Earth
events.description:
Space Talk: 2pm - 3pm

CubeSat Workshop: 3pm - 5pm

(separate registration required for workshop: http://peatix.com/event/285669 )

How do astronauts spend their days in outer space, living on board the International Space Station (ISS)? What is it like to do a spacewalk, flying nearly 28,000 km/hr while floating 400 km above Planet Earth?

To learn about life in space, join us for a talk by NASA Commander Jeff Williams, an experienced astronaut who has spent 534 days on board the ISS and executed 5 spacewalks.

events.name: SPECIAL TALK: Understanding Cybersecurity and How to Safeguard Your Emails & e-Transactions - Aug 5 (Sat)
events.description:
Understanding Cybersecurity and How to Safeguard Your Emails & Transactions - Aug 5 (Sat)





Speaker: Tony Chew (Former Technology Risk Director at Monetary Authority of Singapore)
"During my tenure at the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS), I led the development of a clear set of guidelines for assessing, managing and monitoring technology risks and security standards in the financial industry.
These guidelines that are periodically updated in a timely fashion cover various aspects of regulatory security expectation and performance pertaining to high levels of reliability, availability, resilience and recoverability of critical IT systems. It also stipulates regulatory requirements for systems and operational controls to protect customer data and systems access." - Tony Chew
events.location: Brahm Centre, 71 Irrawaddy Rd, Ren Ci Hospital #03-09, Singapore 329562 null
